key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA fares matched J2’s website pricing on 92.2% of itineraries last week, though higher OTA premiums climbed to 5.88% with limited discounts under 1%.
MSE presented lower-than-site fares in 73.5% of itineraries with an average 0.04% discount and recorded no instances of higher-than-website pricing.
GDS listings split evenly between 50% exact matches and 49% carrying slight premiums (0.07% avg), with discounted offers remaining under 1%.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Price parity between the OTA channel and J2’s website accounted for 92.2% of itineraries last week, underscoring consistent pricing alignment.
Instances of higher OTA fares reached 5.88% last week, marking a 4.62% weekly increase and carrying an average 0.22% premium.
Lower OTA fares remained below 1% of itineraries, with an average discount of 0.15%, indicating limited undercutting of website prices.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA offers were absent for 0.98% of itineraries last week, a 0.91% decline from the prior week.
Exact fare matches held at 92.16% last week, down 4.07% week-on-week and 3.84% month-on-month.
OTA fares priced above the website occurred in 5.88% of cases, up 4.62% from the previous week, with an average 0.22% markup.
OTA fares undercut the site in only 0.98% of itineraries last week, with a modest average discount of 0.15%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes mirrored overall trends with 92.16% parity, a 5.88% share of higher OTA fares and under 1% discounts last week.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For AZ origins, price parity was 91.07% last week, while higher OTA fares rose to 5.36% and discounts held at 1.79%.
Non-AZ origins saw 91.67% parity and 6.25% higher OTA fares last week, with no missing offers and 2.08% discounted fares.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings showed 89.33% parity last week, an 8.00% share of higher OTA fares (up 6.23%) and 1.33% lower prices.
Far-out bookings maintained 100% price parity with the website, with no deviations observed last week.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE fares were lower than Azerbaijan Airlines’ site rates on 73.5% of itineraries in the latest week, rising 4.9 pp month-over-month despite a slight 0.4 pp week-over-week dip.
When MSE pricing was lower, the average discount was just 0.04% last week, and this variance has stayed within ±0.03% over the past month.
There were zero instances of MSE fares exceeding site prices across all dimensions in the latest period.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 21.6% of itineraries lacked MSE offers last week, up 1.8 pp from the prior week and down 3.8 pp versus last month.
Only 4.9% of itineraries showed identical pricing, decreasing 1.5 pp week-on-week and 1.1 pp month-on-month.
73.5% of MSE fares were below site rates, down 0.4 pp from the prior week but up 4.9 pp from a month ago.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: On short-haul routes, 73.5% of MSE offers were cheaper last week, a slight 0.4 pp drop week-on-week and a 4.9 pp gain versus last month, with an average discount of 0.04%.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: MSE fares from Azerbaijan were lower on 92.6% of itineraries last week, up 4.4 pp week-on-week and 3.7 pp month-over-month, at an average 0.04% discount.
Non-AZ bookings saw lower MSE pricing on 52.1% of itineraries—a 4.9 pp weekly decline but a 7.2 pp increase from a month ago—while 45.8% had no MSE presence.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For bookings within a short window, 73.3% of MSE fares were lower last week, down 5.9 pp week-on-week but up 1.9 pp month-over-month, with a consistent 0.04% discount.
For early purchases, 74.1% of MSE offers were cheaper in the latest week, a substantial 14.5 pp rise week-on-week and 11.9 pp month-on-month, at an average 0.05% discount.

gds_highlights.line_content: Approximately 50% of GDS listings exactly match the website fares, while 49% carry a slight premium and under 1% are discounted.
GDS-higher share increased by 2.35 pp month-over-month to 49.02% with last-week average premium at 0.07%, up from 0.05%.
Listings priced below the website account for just 0.98% of GDS volume last week, offering an average 0.15% discount.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Exact-fare listings represent 50.00% of GDS itineraries last week, down 1.27 pp versus the prior week and 2.67 pp versus the prior month.
Routes with GDS premiums account for 49.02% of listings, up 0.29 pp week-over-week and 2.35 pp month-over-month, with an average markup of 0.07% last week.
Discounted itineraries are rare at 0.98% share, rising from zero, with average price 0.15% below website rates.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes mirror overall GDS performance: 49.02% priced higher, 50.00% matched, with premium share up 2.35 pp month-over-month and 0.07% average markup.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: AZ-origin routes show 92.73% fare parity, down 4.77 pp month-over-month, while 5.45% carry a 0.25% average GDS premium.
Non-AZ origins are uniformly priced above website levels on GDS (100% of itineraries) with an average premium of 0.05%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings split evenly: 49.33% parity and 49.33% premium (0.07% avg), with premium share up 3.11 pp month-over-month; discounts at 1.33%.
Far-out bookings deliver 51.85% parity and 48.15% premiums (0.04% avg), up 1.48 pp versus prior month, with no observed discounts.
